thread.title: Gionee Steel 2 with 5-inch HD display, 32GB storage and 4,000mAh battery unveiled
thread.title_full: Gionee Steel 2 with 5-inch HD display, 32GB storage and 4,000mAh battery unveiled

title: Gionee Steel 2 with 5-inch HD display, 32GB storage and 4,000mAh battery unveiled
text:
Gionee Steel 2 with 5-inch HD display, 32GB storage and 4,000mAh battery... Gionee Steel 2 with 5-inch HD display, 32GB storage and 4,000mAh battery unveiled By January 12, 2017 “The Steel 2 is a budget offering with 3GB of RAM, VoLTE, and 8MP/5MP cameras” 
Gionee has expanded its range of Android smartphones with the launch of the Steel 2 in its home market of China. The Steel 2 is a budget offering that comes with a fingerprint sensor, which is integrated into its home button. A 4,000mAh battery is the main highlight of the phone, which the brand claims can deliver 45 hours of talk time and 22 days of battery life. 
As far as the other specs go, the Gionee Steel 2 features a 5-inch HD IPS display bearing a pixel density of 293ppi. It is powered by a quad-core MediaTek MT6737 processor, mated to 3GB of RAM. The phone comes in 16GB and 32GB storage variants, which both accept microSD cards up to 128GB in size. Software-wise, it boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow with Amigo 3.5 UI on top. 
The camera department on the Gionee Steel 2 includes an 8-megapixel primary snapper with an LED flash, and a 5-megapixel secondary shooter. In terms of connectivity, the phone offers 4G, VoLTE, dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and GPS. The device measures 8.6mm around the waist, and tips the scale at 140 grams. 
The Gionee Steel 2 16GB variant has been priced at RMB 1,299, roughly Rs 12,800. The phone is up for pre-order in China in Jazz Gold and Gold Black colours.
